attributes.action: Support full time healthcare students with their finances whilst doing shifts!
attributes.additional_details:
The students who started their degree in September 2017 no longer receive a bursary, requiring a loan to be taken out. Travel may take up to 2hours to get to placement & to then complete these hours while studying for exams, essays.. try to continue socialising & work alongside. Midwives&nurses are being called out for-this explains why. Trainee nurse associates are being paid yet these students don’t?

https://www.gov.uk/nhs-bursaries/eligibility
https://www.rcn.org.uk/
https://www.rcm.org.uk/
attributes.background: Most students midwives/nurses require to do 12.5hour day/night shifts; 37.5hours a week. A fair wage would help cover living costs & provide support during studies. This explains the high drop out rate. Most time is committed to completing the degree= loss of socialising & chances to work alongside.
